contentList.content: <font color='#80FFC3'>Using 1 soul from the Phylactery, you create a new staff.</font>
<font color='#87365C' size='18'>Death comes for you at last...</font>

You have power over the Undead, allowing you to control an undead being for [ExtraData:LLLICH_DominateUndead_Turns] turn(s).
Undead with an Intelligence higher than [ExtraData:LLLICH_DominateUndead_IntResistance] have a chance to resist the effect.
The last enemy in battle, or Undead with an Intelligence of [ExtraData:LLLICH_DominateUndead_IntImmunity] or higher are immune to mental control.

Place your chilling hand on the target, dealing [1].
If the target is Wet/Chilled, apply Frozen for 1 turn.
If the target is not Wet/Chilled/Frozen, apply Chilled for 2 turns.
If the target is Frozen, deal [2].

Character is an immortal, undead sorcerer.
Immunity to Bleeding & Suffocating
Chance to Resist Fear & Stunned
Lich Powers Unlocked
Character is slowly regenerating through the power of a Phylactery.
<font color='#80FFC3'>The Souls satiate you for now. Your Phylactery is at full power.</font>

Change race to an undead lich equivalent (Dwarf -> Undead Dwarf Lich, etc)? LeaderLib will attempt to preserve your skills, talents, items, gender, max source points, and preset, but changing races may have unforseen consequences.
Be sure to save first!

Note: Origin/companion characters will simply be "transformed" to an undead version, to hopefully preserve their voices. This will reset their experience, but they should be leveled back to their previous level. New: Currently you can preserve your experience if you transform while solo.
<font color='#FF001F'>You can't extract your soul while in combat!</font>

Breathe chilling wind in a cone, dealing [1] damage to all non-allied characters and freezing the ground.
If the target is Chilled/Wet, apply Frozen for 1 turn.
Otherwise, apply Chilled for 2 turns.
Changing races may modify your portrait and custom appearance options. Be sure to visit the respec mirror afterwards.
Refresh Passive Lich Statuses - Will reapply the Lich Form status, and the Undying status (if your Phylactery exists). Also adds your Lich/Phylactory skills back, if they're missing.

After using a damaging <font color='#73F6FF'>Lichdom</font> or <font color='#D040D0'>Necromancy</font> spell, active this skill to drain <font color='#97FBFF'>[ExtraData:LLLICH_SoulReaper_DamageHealPercentage]%</font> of the damage dealt from the target's <font color='#97FBFF'>Vitality</font>.

Teleport to your Phylactery.
If your phylactery is in possession of an opposing player (not in your party), teleportation will be blocked.
<font color='#80FFC3'>Your Phylactery has grown even more powerful.</font>
An eerie-looking amulet. Something seems off...

Store your soul in a Phylactery, granting immortality as long as it is not destroyed.
Only one Phylactery per Lich can exist at a time.
Upon nearly dying, you will be teleported to your Phylactery to regenerate. If the Phylactery is in your inventory, you will regenerate at the location of your 'death'.
Character has sacrificed the blood of a living being.
<font color='#FF001F'>Teleport failed. Your phylactery is in possession of an unknown party.</font>
*Cancel the process, returning your soul to your body.*
*The ritual fails, as you already have a Phylactery active.*
An strange-looking jar pulsating with immense power.
<font color='#FF001F'>A phylactery with souls is required to create a new staff.</font>
<font color='#FF001F'>Your Phylactery was broken! It whispers for more souls...</font>
*This box has an unusual feel to it...*
Redeem for a random Lich's Staff.

Sacrifice the blood of a non-undead target character, receiving <font color='#00FF00'>1 AP</font> and a <font color='#B823CB'>[1]% damage boost</font>, while reducing the target's Constitution by [2].
<font color='#C7A758' size='18'>Saving Throw Success for Fear</font>
An strange-looking box. Something seems off...
A trusty companion for any would-be Lich.
*The Phylactery is now complete. As long it remains, death will not be permanent, though each death will damage the Phylactery.*
Unhide armor. You may need to re-equip your armor for the visuals to come back.
<font color='#80FFC3'>Phylactery Power unlocked. Death has no claim on your soul.</font>
*Use a skull ring for the Phylactery.*

Accumulate magical energy while spells are cast in combat.
At full power, your next spell deals a guaranteed critical hit and lowers all cooldowns greater than 1 by 1 turn.
<font color='#80FFC3'>Your Phylactery has grown more powerful.</font>
A grimoire adorned with two skulls. It pulsates with a strange power.
[RESET] Run the Lich Reset Command - This will reset/remove all related Lich flags, statuses, and skills.
<font color='#87365C' size='18'>Teleportation to your Phylactery is blocked by an unknown power...</font>

Launch a soul-infused missile from your staff that deals [1] and marks the target for death.
If the target dies while marked, their soul explodes for [2] within a [3] radius.
<font color='#FF001F'>Teleported to the nearest waypoint to avoid lava.</font>
<font color='#FF001F'>Teleport failed. The phylactery is in your inventory.</font>
Disable Lich Penalties (Negative Fire Resistance, etc)
Hide Phylactory Beam (Note: Disabling the Phylactory status also hides this beam)
<font color='#73F6FF'>The source of a Lich's immortality. Protect this at all cost.</font>
Use the template's "custom looks". This will make you look like what your origin undead equivalent should look like, but hair and skin color options won't have any effect.
Enable Lich Penalties (Negative Fire Resistance, etc) [Default]

Character is being controlled through psychic domination.
Automatically cleansed if the source of domination is disabled or dies.
A lich is a spellcaster who has unnaturally extended their life through storing their soul within a phylactery.
*Before your soul is completely extracted, you look for an object to contain it...*
Enable Phylactory Beam - When near your Phylactory, a beam will appear between you and it.

Change race to what it was previously? (Undead Dwarf -> Dwarf, etc)? LeaderLib will attempt to preserve your skills, talents, items, gender, max source points, and preset, but changing races may have unforseen consequences. Be sure to save first!

If killed, character's soul will erupt, dealing damage within a 3m range.
Only targets enemies of the source of this status.
<font color='#C7A758' size='18'>Saving Throw Success for Stunned</font>

Character is full of dread.
If killed, may spread Fear or Madness to other characters with Dread.

Character has an icey aura of death.
When turn ends, remove Burning and Warm from allies, apply Chilled to enemies, and leach health from Frozen enemies.

Character is immortal through the power of a Phylactery.
Phylactery Powers Unlocked

Exude a chilling aura of death for 3 turns, gaining [1]% Water Resistance, Immunity to Slipping and Burning, and [2]% increased speed on ice.
At the end of your turn, allies within [3] who are Burning or Warm are cooled down, enemies within [3] are Chilled, and Frozen enemies take [4], healing you for the damage dealt.
[SETUP] Run the Lich Setup Command - This will apply all the necessary commands to become a Lich (like if you selected the preset).
*Use a small, inconspicous box for the Phylactery.*
An eerie-looking skull ring. Something seems off...
Shadow damage bypasses armor and cannot be resisted.

Lichdom
A magical contraption used to extract and preserve a soul.
Use to create a Phylactery.
Use the template's "custom looks". This will make you look like what your origin undead equivalent should look like, but hair and skin color options won't have any effect.

Drain the soul of an enemy, dealing [1].
If at max Source Points when this skill kills the target, create an explosion of source, dealing [2] to enemies in a [3] radius.
Shadow Damage bypasses armor and cannot be resisted.
*You activate the Soul Extractor. The magic within pulsates and begins to rip the soul from your body.*
An strange-looking jar. Something seems off...
<font color='#80FFC3'>Your Phylactery is fully powered and restored.</font>
<font color='#80FFC3'>LIchdom was updated, and your Phylactery was reset in order to refresh its stats. Have a wonderful day.</font>
Hide armor. This will equip an invisible item to your overhead that hides all equipped armor. You may need to re-equip your armor to make it invisible after hiding.

Hemomancy
Call forth the blood of beings within [1], causing it to burst.
Living targets create a small pool of blood, while the undead spill poison.
An strange-looking box pulsating with immense power.
<font color='#FF001F'>Teleport failed. The phylactery is broken.</font>

Drain [1] Vitality from [2] (damaged by [3]).
If vitality is full, transfer the heal to the nearest ally within 16m, prioritizing party members low on health.
This spell is non-lethal, and cannot kill the target.
[RACE] Change Race to Undead Lich Race
An eerie-looking skull ring pulsating with immense power..

Let loose a dreadful shout, lowering the primary attributes of enemies within a [1] radius for 3 turns.
On death, nearby characters with Dread have a:
50% chance to become Feared
25% chance to become Mad
*Use a jar, typically used for storing source, for the Phylactery.*

Deal [1] damage to a target character, paralyzing them for 1 turn.
If the target does not have Magic Armor, apply Stunned.
Otherwise, if the target does not have Physical Armor, apply Knocked Down.

*Your soul fully leaves your body, transferring to the selected object. While you now feel a hollow emptiness, the power pulsating within the Phylactery feels forever chained to your being, supplying an intangible sense of warmth.*
An eerie-looking amulet pulsating with immense power.
*Use an eerie-looking amulet for the Phylactery.*
<font color='#80FFC3'>You power your Phylactery with a new soul.</font>
